remarks.p: Initial publication.
Updated for annual assessment.

role.title: Prepared By
role.desc: The organization that prepared this SSP. If developed in-house, this is the CSP itself.

role.title: Prepared For
role.desc: The organization for which this SSP was prepared. Typically the CSP.

role.title: System Security Plan Approval
role.desc: The individual or individuals accountable for the accuracy of this SSP.

role.title: Information System Owner
role.desc: The individual within the CSP who is ultimately accountable for everything related to this system.

role.title: Authorizing Official
role.desc: The individual or individuals who must grant this system an authorization to operate.

role.title: Authorizing Official's Point of Contact
role.desc: The individual representing the authorizing official.

role.title: Information System Management Point of Contact (POC)
role.desc: The highest level manager who responsible for system operation on behalf of the System Owner.

role.title: Information System Technical Point of Contact
role.desc: The individual or individuals leading the technical operation of the system.

role.title: General Point of Contact (POC)
role.desc: A general point of contact for the system, designated by the system owner.

role.title: System Information System Security Officer (or Equivalent)
role.desc: The individual accountable for the security posture of the system on behalf of the system owner.

role.title: Privacy Official's Point of Contact
role.desc: The individual responsible for the privacy threshold analysis and if necessary the privacy impact assessment.

role.title: Owner of an inventory item within the system.
Administrative responsibility an inventory item within the system.
ICA POC (Local)
role.desc: The point of contact for an interconnection on behalf of this system.

remarks.p: Remove this role if there are no ICAs.

role.title: ICA POC (Remote)
role.desc: The point of contact for an interconnection on behalf of this external system to which this system connects.

remarks.p: Remove this role if there are no ICAs.

role.title: ICA Signatory (Local)
role.desc: Responsible for signing an interconnection security agreement on behalf of this system.

remarks.p: Remove this role if there are no ICAs.

role.title: ICA Signatory (Remote)
role.desc: Responsible for signing an interconnection security agreement on behalf of the external system to which this system connects.

remarks.p: Remove this role if there are no ICAs.

role.title: Consultant
role.desc: Any consultants involved with developing or maintaining this content.

role.title: Federal Risk and Authorization Management Program (FedRAMP) Program Management Office (PMO)
Federal Risk and Authorization Management Program (FedRAMP) Joint Authorization Board (JAB)

remarks.p: There must be one location identifying the CSP's primary business address, such as the CSP's HQ, or the address of the system owner's primary business location.
There must be one location for each data center.
There must be at least two data centers.
For a data center, briefly summarize the components at this location.
All data centers must have a conformity tag of "data-center".
A primary data center must also have a conformity tag of "primary-data-center".
There must be one location for each data center.
There must be at least two data centers.
For a data center, briefly summarize the components at this location.
All data centers must have a conformity tag of "data-center"
An alternate or backup data center must also have a conformity tag of "alternate-data-center".
Replace sample CSP information.

party.party-name: Federal Risk and Authorization Management Program: Program Management Office

remarks.p: This party entry must be present in a FedRAMP SSP.
The uuid may be different; however, the uuid must be associated with the "fedramp-pmo" role in the responsible-party assemblies.

party.party-name: Federal Risk and Authorization Management Program: Joint Authorization Board

remarks.p: This party entry must be present in a FedRAMP SSP.
The uuid may be different; however, the uuid must be associated with the "fedramp-jab" role in the responsible-party assemblies.
Generic placeholder for any external organization.
Generic placeholder for an authorizing agency.
Underlying service provider. Leveraged Authorization.
Exactly one
Exactly one
One or more
Exactly one
One or more
Exactly one
Exactly one
Exactly one
Exactly one
Exactly one
Exactly one
Exactly one
This OSCAL-based FedRAMP SSP Template can be used for the FedRAMP Low, Moderate, and High baselines.
Guidance for OSCAL-based FedRAMP Tailored content has not yet been developed.

description.p: Automatically generated OSCAL SSP from OpenControl guidance for Red Hat OpenShift Dedicated
This item is useless nevertheless required.
A holistic, top-level explanation of the FedRAMP authorization boundary.
The entire system as depicted in the system authorization boundary
